page.title: 07A child's life - Blackheath
page.content: I got up at 0853.I washed,dressed & woke my sister,Zoe,aged 9.I asked her to help carry boxes of books from the car.They were my grandma's:she didn't want them.For a half hour we sorted the books.Zoe had her breakfast & I cleared kitchen.I read "The Great Piratical Ru- mbustification" & "The Librarian & The Robbers" by M.Mahy.At 1030,I woke Mum. She sent me to buy the"Sunday Times" & the "OBSERVER".I read the "S.Times Ma- gazine" in my room.Mum told me to phone Aunt Jane to ask if we could drop in for morning coffee.She invited us for lunch.We gladly accepted.Before lunch we played cricket.After a delicious lu- nch of pork,potatoes & beans we built a cubby in the apple tree.At 1415 the fa- mily watched Wimbledon Men's final & booed & cheered together.After collect- ing Zoe from a party I saw Becker win. We left at 1800.I went to bed at 2030.
